Standard_Text: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to duck).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and content.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Vocabulary Acquisition and Use
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: (Begins in grade 2)

Standard_Text: Knowledge of Language
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short-vowel sounds (phonemes).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Recognize and name end punctuation.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Understand and use question words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/ (e.g., dog, dogs; wish, wishes).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Print many upper- and lowercase letters.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Conventions of Standard English
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Language Standards
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Vocabulary Acquisition and Use
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Knowledge of Language
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Conventions of Standard English
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and support, provide additional detail.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Presentation of Knowledge and Ideas
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Understand and follow one- and two-step oral directions.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others and taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Comprehension and Collaboration
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Speaking and Listening Standards
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Presentation of Knowledge and Ideas
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Comprehension and Collaboration
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Range of Writing
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: (Begins in grade 4)
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of books by a favorite author and express opinions about them).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: (Begins in grade 2)
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Production and Distribution of Writing
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked events, tell about the events in the order in which they occurred, and provide a reaction to what happened.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts in which they name what they are writing about and supply some information about the topic.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces in which they tell a reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing about and state an opinion or preference about the topic or book (e.g., My favorite book is…).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Text Types and Purposes
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Writing Standards
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Range of Writing
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Production and Distribution of Writing
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Text Types and Purposes
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Read emergent-reader texts with purpose and understanding.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Fluency
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Read common high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Associate the long and short sounds with common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels. (Identify which letters represent the five major vowels [Aa, Ee, Ii, Oo, and Uu] and know the long and short sound of each vowel. More complex long vowel graphemes and spellings are targeted in the grade 1 phonics standards.)
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondences by producing the primary or many of the most frequent sound for each consonant.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words both in isolation and in text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Phonics and Word Recognition
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Blend two to three phonemes into recognizable words.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonent-vowel-consonent, or CVC) words. (This does not include CVCs ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/.)
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Recognize and produce rhyming words.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Phonological Awareness
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

Standard_Text: With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

Standard_Text: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the text in which they appear (e.g., what person, place, thing, or idea in the text an illustration depicts).

Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

Standard_Text: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.(See grade K Language standards 4–6 additional expectations.)

Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Integration of Knowledge and Ideas
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
